The '''Taeglin''' was a river in [[Beler: It rose in the [[Ered Wethrin]] and flowed southeast through [[Brethil]] to join Sirion on the borders of [[Doriath]]. It had two minor tributaries: [[Celebros]] and [[Malduin]].
The river could be forded at the [[Crossings of the Taeglin]]
near the western border of Brethil. A road ran through it from [[Nargothrond]] to [[Minas Tirith (Beleriand)|Minas Tirith]].
the river was called '''Teiglin'''. As revealed in the ''[[The History of Middle-earth]]'' series
column3: the rivername should actually have been spelt ''Taeglin'' ("Boundary River").<ref name="WJ"/> This was a relatively late change which was not adopted into the published ''[[The Silmarillion]]''
